result.execSummary:
Ruben M Cruz was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Ruben M Cruz was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ruben M Cruz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from the Court stating deft shall be released from custody immediately; faxed to booking per Conveyance (Klinkhammer).  Email with order also sent to conveyance.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Braun appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Rufo.  Deft wishes to waive extradition to Texas.  Deft signs the waiver papers.  Court grants the extradition.  Deft may be surrendered to the Texas authorities.  Atty Rufo requests bond modification/reduction due to the deft's health issues.  Motion denied at this time; however, court will reconsider the bond motion after the State has an opportunity to speak with the Texas DA's office - State to file a statement on their position by 1/12/15.

3:01pm  Attorney Tom Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson. Clerk:LErvin.  Referred to Br.3 for further disposition on 01-06-2015 at 11:30am, extradition waiver hearing.  Deft wishes to waive extradition. $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
and witness list filed by the State
